overall.suggested_improvements: Revise the sentence so all options are grammatically compatible with the complement. For example: 1) Keep verbs but change the complement type: “The detective examined the clues carefully and ______ that [name] had taken the missing necklace…” (then replace D with a verb that fits a ‘that’-clause, e.g., “thought” instead of “wondered”), or 2) Change the frame to an adjective/noun complement that works uniformly: “The detective examined the clues carefully and was ______ about who had taken the missing necklace,” with options like “certain,” “confident,” “suspicious,” “curious.” Either approach preserves the intended shades-of-meaning distinction without a syntactic mismatch.
